title: Jack L. Warner
summary: Jack Leonard Warner (born Jacob Warner;[1] August 2, 1892 â€“ September 9, 1978) was a Canadian-American film executive, born in Canada, who was the president and driving force behind the Warner Bros. Studios in Burbank, California. Warner's career spanned some 45 years, its duration surpassing that of any other of the seminal Hollywood studio moguls.[2]
